title.narrative: Stöd till miljö CSO i Kosovo 2017-2020

description.narrative: Regional Environmental Centre (REC) Kosovo har ansökt om stöd på 17 miljoner SEK från Ambassaden/Sida för att projektet "Environmental CSO Support in Kosovo Species – Sustainable Environmental Civil Society Support". Insatsen syftar till att stärka och specialisera civilsamhällsorganisationer med fokus på miljöfrågor i Kosovo, i syfte att hjälpa samhället som helhet att identifiera behoven inom miljöområdet, tillhandahålla tjänster och stöd till kommuner, utveckla partnerskap och nätverk för att lyfta nationella miljömässiga prioriteringar inom ramen för SDG:s hållbara utvecklingsmål med fokus på luft, vatten och sopavfall. Insatsens totala budget är 18 000 000 SEK, varav 17 000 000 avtalas med REC för genomförande av projektet och därtill 1 miljon SEK som är avsedd att användas av Ambassaden/Sida för halvtidsöversyn 2019 och slututvärdering 2021.

Regional Environmental Centre (REC) Kosovo has applied to Sida/Embassy for funding of 17 million SEK to carry out the project "Environmental CSO Support in Kosovo Species – Sustainable Environmental Civil Society Support". The intervention aims at strengthening and specializing environmental civil society in Kosovo, which along with the community is able to articulate their needs, provide services and support, develop partnerships and networks, capable to address country environmental priorities and progress towards implementation of sustainable development goals with the focus on air, water and waste. The intervention’s total budget is 18 000 000 SEK, however the total requested support amounts to 17 million SEK. The other 1 million SEK will be used by the Embassy/Sida for mid-term review and the final evaluation of the contribution.

Results Strategy for Sweden’s Reform Cooperation with Eastern Europe, The Western Balkans and Turkey 2014 – 2020, result area 3: better environment, reduced climate impact and enhanced resilience to environmental impact and climate change- Enhanced environmental responsibility among the general public, the business sector and civil society. The proposed intervention aim at strengthening and specializing environmental civil society in Kosovo, which along with the community is able to articulate their needs, provide services and support, develop partnerships and networks, capable to address country environmental priorities and progress towards implementation of sustainable development goals with the focus on air, water and waste. In addition, the proposed intervention will support implementation of the Implementation of Sustainable Development Goals with the focus on Goal 6, 11, 12, and 15: (including all relevant targets from other SDGS) - targeting Central and National Level of the institutions in Kosovo

tag.narrative: 13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Sida’s funded program aimed at promoting multi-level advancement of environmental CSO's in Kosovo. The “Sustainable Environmental Civil Society Support - SPECIES Program” main objective is to strengthen and specialize environmental civil society organizations in Kosovo, which along with the community is able to articulate their needs, provide services and support, develop partnerships and networks, capable to address country environmental priorities and progress towards implementation of sustainable development goals with the focus on air, water and waste. The Sida HQ has recommended to embassies to terminate all the agreements with REC offices in the region due to critical governance and financial situation at REC Head Office in Hungary. A written Termination Letter was distributed to the REC Office Kosovo representatives. In the aftermath, as of October 2018, all future planned activities are terminated and followed by a five month Program Phase Out that entered into force from October 2018 – February 2019. Due to a termination of this intervention after less than a year of its implementation the planned results have not been achieved.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
